Line 1897:                                         The European languages are members of the same family. Their separate existence is a myth.

Line 1899:                                         in their grammar, their pronunciation and their most common words. Everyone realizes why a
Line 1900:                                         new common language would be desirable: one could refuse to pay expensive translators. To
Line 1901:                                         achieve this, it would be necessary to have uniform grammar, pronunciation and more common
